Lateral fan-shaped neuron ExFl1.Definition: Extrinsic lateral fan-shaped neuron that projects posteriorly, arborizing in the middle inferior medial protocerebrum and lateral accessory lobe (ventral body), before projecting across the midline to circle around the contralateral side of the ellipsoid body, and innervates the fan-shaped body. Innervation of the lateral accessory lobes is presynaptic, whilst that of the fan-shaped body is postsynaptic. The cell bodies of neurons in this class cluster in the cortex dorsal to the antennal lobes.
